page.title: 05Travelling
page.content: The different methods of Travel in Thurso are by train, bus, car, motor cycle and bicycle. There are 3 trains per day from Thurso to Inverness at 06.00, 12.00 and 18.00. The journey takes four hours and may be from 2 minutes to many hours late because of heavy snow. Housewives use the town's bus service when shopping. Children from outlying districts use buses to come to school and after swimming lessons at the Pool. Fleets of double decker buses take workers to and from Dounreay. Most bicycles are ridden by children. Nearly everyone owns a car. A Traffic Count taken at the junction of Castlegreen Road and Scrabster Road showed that 347 cars, 8 bicycles, 3 motorbikes, 24 buses, 1 moped and 1 tractor passed in the morning rush hour.
